intro.description: The following steps show how to locate ProcessVariables in the archive and add them to a plot.

item.title: Open new Plot
item.description: Select CSS->Trends->Data Browser in the menu bar at the top of the workbench.

item.title: Open Search Panel
item.description: Right-click on the Plot, select "Open Archive Search Panel".

item.title: Select Archive Server
item.description:
Ideally, you can ignore this step:
The "URL:" in the search panel should be set to the default archive data server for your site, but you can optionally select a different archive data server.
Some archive data servers might provide several sub-archives. They will be listed below the "URL:", in which case you can select one or more sub-archives to search.

item.title: Search for Process Variables
item.description:
Enter a process variable name "Pattern" and press "Search".
For simple search pattern, do not check the "Reg.Exp." box and use "?" to represent any single character, '*' to represent several arbitrary characters. Click the (?) button above for more details from the online help.
You can search multiple times, either "Add..." the results to the list or "Replace..." the search results until you have located the desired PV names.

item.title: Drag PVs into the Plot Data Browser
item.description:
Select PV Name from the search result by clicking on it with the left mouse button. Depending on the operating system, you can click while holding the Shift, Control, Command, or Alt keys to select multiple PV names in the list.
Finally, click one selected PV again and while holding the mouse button down, drag them into the Data Browser plot window, then release the left mouse button.
